title: GLCH program helping locals recover and stay out of hospital
desc: When Helen Pollard returned home from her first – and last – cruise, she came down with a severe chest infection. Living in Sarsfield in the home she built with her late husband Denis, Helen found recovery challenging, especially after caring for Denis for many years until his passing in May last year.Thanks to a Support at Home package – a Federal Government–subsidised program that helps older people remain living independently – Helen was able to access an eight-week pulmonary rehabilitation program at Gippsland Lakes Complete Health's gym in Lakes Entrance."Now that program is really good," Helen said."I was nervous at first because I haven't exercised much for years, but it made a real difference."The Pulmonary Rehabilitation Program is designed for people living with chronic lung disease or other respiratory conditions. Combining exercise, education, and support, the evidence-based program helps participants improve breathing, strength, and confidence while safely managing symptoms.Exercise physiologist Nara Venkatesan said pulmonary rehab is vital in keeping people well and out of hospital, particularly in regional areas with limited specialist care."Pulmonary rehab helps people recover after respiratory illness, reduces breathlessness, and improves day-to-day function," she said. "It also reduces the risk of hospital readmission."Chronic lung disease rates in East Gippsland are higher than metropolitan areas, driven by an ageing population and higher smoking rates. For Helen, the program has boosted both her fitness and strength and complemented her Support at Home package."I knew after Denis passed that my home was too big to manage alone," Helen said. "I have a wonderful daughter, but she has a life and a family too. The help you get is very, very good. I just hope more people will take the message – I'm in my mid-80s, and a lot of people are too stubborn to ask for help, but it really makes a difference."To join the pulmonary rehabilitation program or learn more about support for lung disease and breathlessness, contact Gippsland Lakes Complete Health
